result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:25 PM (64-06)  Defendant Chad Fryderick Kiefer in court.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Chad Fryderick Kiefer. 
State called to the stand as a witness Officer Josh Girdaukas.
Josh Girdaukas duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination of ADA Berg. Witness identified the defendant in Court.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed in court. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
2:28 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Jochman.
Evidence is closed.
Argument by the State. Requesting probable cause.
Argument by Attorney Jochman. Requesting case be dismissed.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Jochman acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to the charges on behalf of his client.

Attorney Jachman requests Motion Hearing to amend bond, argument by Attorney Jochman. State objects to Motion Hearing, victim is not present in court.
Court will hold open Motion for Bond Hearing to allow victim to be present in court.

adj. 2:38 PM

3:31 PM Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Andrew Herrmann in court.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Chad Fryderick Kiefer. Chad Fryderick did not appear in court.
Court in session for a Preliminary Hearing.
Attorney Jochman made a record as to the non appearance of his client.
ADA Herrmann is requesting a Warrant be issued for Chad Fryderick's arrest.
Attorney Jochman requests the Warrant be stayed until next court date.
ADA Herrmann is requesting officer's fees. Court will withhold order for fees at this time.

Court will issued a Warrant, STAYED until 04-04-2022 at 2PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Chad Fryderick Kiefer appeared, Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is asking for more time to retain private counsel. Defendant given MFAC paperwork. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Chad Fryderick Kiefer appeared, Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant not in Court. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has COVID type symptoms. Minutes filed.
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH H.M. OR RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
